vault/notes/•-general-•/research/cat-all.title: Cat Allergies Research (Reduction of Symptoms)
vault/notes/•-general-•/research/cat-all.description:
General: CAT ALLERGIES
Pet allergy
Allergy to cats
Cat Allergies Causes Fel d 1:
The Crystal Structure of the Major Cat Allergen Fel d 1, a Member of the Secretoglobin Family
Cat skin as an important source of Fel d I allergen
Polymorphism Analysis of  and  Genes in the Siberian CatCh1Ch2
An update on molecular cat allergens: Fel d 1 and what else? Chapter 1: Fel d 1, the major cat allergen Symptoms:Reduction:
HEPA Filter; Hazardous Agent Containment
Evaluation of different techniques for washing cats: Quantitation of allergen removed from the cat and the effect on airborne Fel d 1
Reduction of active Fel d1 from cats using an antiFel d1 egg IgY antibody Treatment:
Immunotherapy with cat- and dog-dander extracts
Is there a vaccine for cat allergy?
Cat Allergy Therapy Fails in Crucial Study
Experimental cat allergy shots provide longer-lasting relief Keywords: cat allergy; cat allergies; cat allergen; Fel d 1; Fel d 4; Fel d 7; "cat allergy" + causes, symptoms, reduction, treatments, vaccine, immunotherapy, therapy, shots, medication,
vault/notes/•-general-•/research/cat-all.sourcePath: Vault/Notes/• General •/Research/Cat Allergies Research (Reduction of Symptoms).md

vault/notes/development/3d/foliage/ultim.title: Ultimate Foliage Modeling Guide∕Research (WIP)
vault/notes/development/3d/foliage/ultim.description:
The ultimate (probably) guide for making your OWN models of trees, plants, and other natural organic stuff! (mostly trees and plants) While a lot of guides and videos talk about low poly and stylized foliage creation, this guide is aimed at the modeling of realistic and semi-realistic looking vegetation; For film, videogames, etc. I'm mainly creating this guide to figure out a way to model high detail realistic foliage, then lower their quality for games, etc. http://wiki.polycount.com/wiki/Foliage Contains links to articles and discussions, has some info about how foliage textures and its vertex normals work, links for some tools, and examples.
The Vegetation of Horizon Zero Dawn Presentation talking about how the foliage works; the wind simulation, shading, texture packing, normals, etc. Uses SpeedTree for Modeling; 5 LODs. Doesn't really go into much details for the asset creation part.
Modular Vegetation Techniques for Games - Billy Matjiunis In-depth walkthrough of a workflow (Uses industry-standard tools) Be sure to choose and identify the plants you want to recreate.
Plant identifying apps: PictureThis, iNaturalist, Pl@ntNet
iNaturalist species list has a ton of images of specific vegetation.
Pl@ntNet species list does too. Go outside and take pictures of the plants you want to recreate. Go outside and take pictures of the specific parts of the plants you want, ideally with a camera or with your phone on a blank background.
iNaturalist CC0 observations (example) Trunk and Stem photogrammetry Removing the background (for leaves) AI Background Removal
Background Removal w/ transformers.js huggingface space
BRIA-RMBG The first one can bleed translucency into the main subject, and the second one, seems sharper and bleeds less, but it always depends so try both. Post-Background-Removal Cleanup with GIMP Open the modified image in GIMP and cleanup the stuff that hasn't been correctly removed. You can use the eraser to manually remove big stuff far from the main subject, then go to Layer->Transparency->Threshold Alpha to get rid of translucency Isolating the bark/stem. (for bark/stem) Sometimes you need to get only the texture of the stem/bark, then make it tileable for wider usage. Creating a texture atlas. (for leaves/branches/small stems) Combine all the leaf/branch textures you've made in a single texture atlas with a transparent background (You can use GIMP or your software of choice) A lot plant/tree models use a single texture atlas for the leaves and branches, so that there is no need to use many different textures files. Conversion to PBR Material. For a realistic look and lighting you need to convert your atlas and bark into a PBR texture set.
You can use Materialize as a free option, or Substance Sampler. Baking modeled branches as a material
Let's Learn Blender!: Two-Sided Leaf Material
Making leaves translucent in BLENDER!
MSC #09 - How to create realistic looking plants (Blender Tutorial EN) - Excellent, but could be tedious work.
How to Create a Low Poly Tree in 1 Minute - Too simple & too low poly for this guide There are many software and blender addons/extensions for the creation of procedural trees, which lowers the amount of work necessary, and they all vary in quality. MTree
How to Create Realistic Trees in Blender Sapling SpeedTree TreeIt

vault/notes/development/3d/projects/one-.title: One Model a Day Progression
vault/notes/development/3d/projects/one-.description:
Last 3D model I made/uploaded was in 2021-11-20. Tomorrow is going to be July 1st 2024.
955 days. 955 models to make. Goal is for all object to be fully modeled, textured, and detailed baked. I'll also allow myself photogrammetry. Deadline: 10+1 new model, every day

vault/notes/development/3d/blender-perso.title: Blender Personal Tips & Tricks
vault/notes/development/3d/blender-perso.description:
Modify tools default settings: e.g. Edit->Preferences->Keymap->Search for "Shear"->Go to "Shear" in the Mesh section, then change the defaults. Extrude edge along the normal orientation of the face its attached to?? Install the Mesh Tools extension -> offset edges -> find extrude in options Convert opacity map to a mesh? (Would be useful for realistic foliage) Snap individual vertices to object/face all at once? Edge-equidistant scaling in one go? How to change increment snapping scale? (Change snapping from 100 cm increments to 1 cm) Change the Grid Scale in the overlay menu. To get from 100 cm to 1 cm change the scale 0.01. Triplanar mapping on the UV texture coordinate setting? Mix high poly to low poly baked normal map with a model using a tiling texture? Bake high poly edge normals to low poly? (make them appear smooth) MatLayer (Currently Broken on 4.2)
DreamUV
Texel Density Checker

vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.title: Blender to Source Engine scaling.
vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.description: https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dimensions_(Half-Life_2_and_Counter-Strike:_Source) We start with the given information: 1 unit in Blender = 1 meter In the Source engine (for this scale), 16 units = 1 foot We need to convert meters to feet: 1 meter = 3.28084 feet (this is a standard conversion) Now we calculate how many Source units are in 1 meter: If 16 Source units = 1 foot, and 1 meter = 3.28084 feet Then 1 meter = 16 * 3.28084 Source units 16 * 3.28084 = 52.4934 This 52.4934 is our scaling factor. It tells us how many Source units are equivalent to 1 Blender unit (1 meter). We start with the given information: 1 unit in Blender = 1 meter In the Source engine (for this scale), 12 units = 1 foot This is the key difference from the previous calculation, where it was 16 units = 1 foot. We need to convert meters to feet: 1 meter = 3.28084 feet (this is a standard conversion, same as before) Now we calculate how many Source units are in 1 meter: If 12 Source units = 1 foot, and 1 meter = 3.28084 feet Then 1 meter = 12 * 3.28084 Source units 12 * 3.28084 = 39.37008 (which rounds to 39.3701) This 39.3701 is our scaling factor. It tells us how many Source units are equivalent to 1 Blender unit (1 meter) for this scale.

headers.heading: Maps, architecture, and some prop models use a scale of 1 foot = 16 units.
Human character models and certain other models for Source currently use 1 foot = 12 units.

vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.sourcePath: Vault/Notes/Development/Valve Engines/Source/Blender to Source Engine scaling..md

vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.title: MOHAA to Source Engine porting.
vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.description: I used multiple programs for this, here's a mostly simple explanation of what I did. For porting the simple world geometry, I used QuArk to open the .map file and then made it useable in hammer. I also manually ported the textures used in the map to a format useable by the source engine. Textures had to be replaced manually. For the more complex geometry (pipes, ladders, barrels, terrain) I used a tool found here: https://www.x-null.net/forums/threads/3542-3d-model-of-Stalingrad-map/page2 to extract it as fbx from the original bsp map file, I then imported it into Blender and I used the SourceOps plugin to export all complex geometry as models to be useable by the source engine, except the terrain, for that I used the displacement exporter included with SourceOps. For the models (trees, cars, etc.) I used LightRay3D to export the MOHAA models from the original .skd format to .obj and exported them as useable models with Blender and SourceOps. I imported a reference for where all the models should be placed, but they were all manually placed by hands. Lighting also had to be done by hand. I also had to scale down the original map by 0.78 since the player scales between games are different.
vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.sourcePath: Vault/Notes/Development/Valve Engines/Source/MOHAA to Source Engine porting..md

vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.title: Porting Source 1 map to Source 2 (For CSGO to CS2)
vault/notes/development/valve-engines/so.description:
Set-up folders (csgo filepath w/ precompiled content & gameinfo file; path to the source files (.vmf & assets)(folder path cannot contain spaces); CS2 gameinfo file)
Install Python
Set-up PATH environment variable
Install colorama (pip install colorama)
Create new addon with the desired name with the workshop tools
Locate import script
Modify import script
Run import script GUI
The script will give out 3 different .vmap (map.vmap; map_prefab.vmap; map_environment_prefab.vmap (This last one will only be there if you use -usebsp))
You can combine them all by collapsing the prefabs.
Replace any surface specific clip textures with the simple clip material
If you have any custom sprites they have to be manually imported; create a .vtex file in the content folder:<!-- dmx encoding keyvalues2_noids 1 format vtex 1 -->
"CDmeVtex"
{ "m_inputTextureArray" "element_array" [ "CDmeInputTexture" { "m_name" "string" "InputTexture0" "m_fileName" "string" "materials/EXAMPLE_SPRITE.tga" "m_colorSpace" "string" "srgb" "m_typeString" "string" "2D" "m_imageProcessorArray" "element_array" [ "CDmeImageProcessor" { "m_algorithm" "string" "None" "m_stringArg" "string" "" "m_vFloat4Arg" "vector4" "0 0 0 0" } ] } ] "m_outputTypeString" "string" "2D" "m_outputFormat" "string" "DXT1" "m_outputClearColor" "vector4" "0 0 0 0" "m_nOutputMinDimension" "int" "0" "m_nOutputMaxDimension" "int" "0" "m_textureOutputChannelArray" "element_array" [ "CDmeTextureOutputChannel" { "m_inputTextureArray" "string_array" [ "InputTexture0" ] "m_srcChannels" "string" "rgba" "m_dstChannels" "string" "rgba" "m_mipAlgorithm" "CDmeImageProcessor" { "m_algorithm" "string" "Box" "m_stringArg" "string" "" "m_vFloat4Arg" "vector4" "0 0 0 0" } "m_outputColorSpace" "string" "srgb" } ] "m_vClamp" "vector3" "0 0 0" "m_bNoLod" "bool" "0"
}
Check if you have any light_omni2 with crazy high brightness & range values and manually fix them. You can use indirect light scale to make a light similar to constant light in source.
The S2 importer will approximate the light probes & cube maps combined entities; you're better off remaking them manually; or if you don't add them, then the lighting will look very bad on non-lightmapped objects. Be sure to make light probe entities touch each other, and to increase resolution size if some lighting looks bad. (If you want bad/retro-looking lighting, uncheck stationary light shadows on the light_environmentJust go to Navigation ->place a Create Walkable Seed anywhere in the playing area ->Nav Preview
You can tweak the navigation mesh by placing nav-clip brushesSounds will not be ported with the script. You will need to import them to a folder of your choosing, then edit the soundevents_addon.vsndevts file by adding the sound file with the desired settings. Add a point_soundevent with the desired soundscape sound and check play to local player and start on spawn.
Or just modify the soundscape, and replace all proxys to be normal soundscapes for them to work.Add a cs_minimap_boundary at the lowest-south-west corner of the map and the highest-north-east corner of it. You can add multiple to generate multiple layers. You can change the resolution of the generated minimap with cs_minimap_output_size "square-resolution"
Create a new material using the material editor with the same name as the radar file, as a composite generic, then add the generated image(s) to the material.
Then edit the map .vtex file name:
mapname_radar to mapname_radar_tga
copy the same file and rename it to mapname_radar_spectate_tgaIf you have a multi layered minimap, you need to edit the mapname.txt in the game addons/resource/overview folder"mapname"
{ "autogenerated_tga" "1" "pos_x" "-1504" "pos_y" "3560" "scale" "4.343750" "verticalsections" { "default" // use the primary radar image - highest point { "AltitudeMax" "10000" "AltitudeMin" "-80" } "1" // mapname_1_radar - middlest point { "AltitudeMax" "-80" "AltitudeMin" "-416" } "0" // mapname_0_radar - lowest point { "AltitudeMax" "-416" "AltitudeMin" "-10000" } }
}
Don't forget to add team_select and related!Normally you should compile with full compile, but if you want more classic (source 1) looking lighting you can reduce the lightmap resolution.

vault/notes/servers/laptop-debian-server.title: Laptop Debian Server
vault/notes/servers/laptop-debian-server.description:
from the main user folder, open a cmd.
and use this command:
ssh elitebook@192.168.0.198 -p 36676 -i yek_hssexplanations:
"ssh" is the software and command used to remote access the server
"elitebook" is the username of the server
"@192.169.0.198" is the ethernet (local) IP of the server. (You can change it in the DHCP settings)
"-p" is an additional option that is able to specify the port used on and to connect to the server.
"-i" is the public key identification, which is a file located on the users PC.
(e.g. in C:\Users\Username in this case)command:
docker restart $(docker ps -a -q) auto-restart the containers unless stopped:
docker update --restart unless-stopped $(docker ps -q)view all docker containers:
docker ps -astart docker container:
docker start [container id]enter docker container:
docker exec -it [container id] bash
Stop & remove the current samba container if it exists docker stop user-samba
docker rm user-samba Create a Dockerfile file; and include this in it:
# Use the official Debian base image
FROM debian # Install Samba and its dependencies
RUN apt-get update && \ apt-get install -y samba samba-common samba-libs # Expose Samba ports
EXPOSE 445 # Start Samba service when the container starts
CMD ["smbd", "--foreground", "--no-process-group"] Open a terminal and navigate to the directory containing the Dockerfile.
Run the docker build command to build the Docker image:
e.g. docker build -t my-samba-image . Replace my-samba-image with the desired name for your Docker image.
Once the image is built, you can run a container from the image using the docker run command: `docker run -it -p 445:445 --name elitebook-samba -v /home/elitebook/cloud/public:/hmnt/public -d my-samba-image
`

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
